taxon_name.authority: (A. Nelson) Cronquist in C. L. Hitchcock et al.

place_of_publication.publication_title: in C. L. Hitchcock et al., Vasc. Pl. Pacif. N.W.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe rudbeckiinae;genus rudbeckia;section macrocline;species laciniata;variety ampla

bio:treatment.description: Leaves: basal 20–50 × 10–25 cm, blades pinnately compound to pinnatifid (basal leaflets or lobes often pinnatifid); proximal and mid cauline blades 5–9-lobed; adaxial faces glabrous or sparsely hairy (hairs arching, 1-seriate). Receptacles ovoid; paleae 4.5–6.5 mm. Ray laminae 25–50 × 7–12 mm. Discs (17–)20–30 × 12–20 mm. Cypselae 4–5.5 mm; pappi mostly longer than 0.7 mm. 2n = 38.
Wet sites, along streams, open meadows;
B.C.; Ariz., Colo., Mont., N.Mex., S.Dak., Wyo.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety ampla grows west of the Great Plains. It is introduced in British Columbia.
